Media.MediaTitle: Late Effects - Peak growth hormone according to hypothalamic mean dose and time after start or irradiation

OriginalSource.Creator: http://jco.ascopubs.org/content/29/36/4776.long
OriginalSource.SourceFilename: Merchant Figure, Late Effects - Peak growth hormone according to hypothalamic mean dose and time after start or irradiation.jpg

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: long-term effects secondary to cancer therapy in children

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Graph shows peak growth hormone (in ng/mL) according to hypothalamic mean dose and time (in months) after start of irradiation.

Captions.MediaCaption: Peak growth hormone (GH) according to hypothalamic mean dose and time after start of irradiation. According to equation 2, peak GH = exp{2.5947 + time × [0.0019 − (0.00079 × mean dose)]}. Thomas E. Merchant, Susan R. Rose, Christina Bosley, Shengjie Wu, Xiaoping Xiong, and Robert H. Lustig, Growth Hormone Secretion After Conformal Radiation Therapy in Pediatric Patients With Localized Brain Tumors, Journal of Clinical Oncology, volume 29, issue 36, pages 4776-4780. Reprinted with permission. © (2011) American Society of Clinical Oncology. All rights reserved.

ProposedUse.Summary: Late Effects of Treatment for Childhood Cancer

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Added new image: Merchant Figure, Late Effects - Peak growth hormone according to hypothalamic mean dose and time after start or irradiation.jpg
